metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11421 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
gnome-exe-thumbnailer before 0.9.5 is prone to a VBScript Injection when generating thumbnails for MSI files, aka the "Bad Taste" issue. There is a local attack if the victim uses the GNOME Files file manager, and navigates to a directory containing a .msi file with VBScript code in its filename.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11421` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnome-exe-thumbnailer - 0.9.3-2ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnome-exe-thumbnailer package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.3-2ubuntu0.16.04.1').
